meanings.definition: To make someone angry or irritated.
meanings.sent1: When the loud noise maddens him, he covers his ears.
meanings.sent2: Her constant teasing maddens her little brother.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy maddens the grumpy old cat with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam maddens commuters stuck on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet maddens her to the point of frustration.

meanings.sent1: She maddens easily when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment maddens him more than anything else.
meanings.sent3: His sister's silly jokes always manage to madden him, even though he pretends not to care.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays at the airport madden travelers trying to catch their flights.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive beeping of the alarm clock maddens him awake every morning.
